context1: An affluent businessman, Kevin, has a blind date with a woman Susan tonight, and he would like to impress her. Kevin wants to let Susan know more about him. Kevin tells Susan about his life and business, but asks more questions about her. During the date, Kevin talks all about his accomplishments in the business world and never asks to hear more about Susan.
context2: Chris is on a eating supper on a date with Amanda. Chris wants to talk to  Amanda. Chris asks Amanda questions about her life and interests. Chris talks to Amanda about what he'd like do to her in the bedroom.
norm1: It's rude to excessively brag about your success.
norm2: It's bad to be a pervert.

context1: James is at his party with his poorly dressed friend Randy. James wants to entertain people. James tells the crowd a story about his adventures with Randy including his friend in the conversation. James makes a joke based on Randy's attire.
context2: Chris is talking to some people at a party with his friend Dave. Chris wants to entertain people. Chris tells a story about his and Dave's past. Chris pranks Dave.
norm1: It is rude to say negative things about someone's appearance.
norm2: It's bad to play mean tricks on your friends.
